DescriptionHtml:
Download app: https://emby.media/emby-for-ios.html

 

A new update is currently rolling out. Here are the highlights.

 

Bug Fixes

  • Resolve issue of music stopping after first track
  • Fix layout of individual collection screen

 

Updated Live TV OSD

 

The time display has been remodeled, and fans of Windows Media Center should feel right at home.

 

 

Live TV Guide Improvements

Simplified Header

DescriptionHtml:
A new release of Emby Server is rolling out. Here are the highlights.

 

Updated Live TV OSD

 

The time display has been remodeled, and fans of Windows Media Center should feel right at home.

 

 

Other Improvements

  • Improve live tv start time
  • Improve live tv images
  • Improve database performance
  • Enable cuvid decoder
  • Speed up audio playback
  • Reduce resource consumption of realtime monitor
  • Show icon for home videos in photo libraries
  • Include home videos in photo slideshows
  • Switch to Skia for image processing (Windows + Mac)
  • Update Bulgarian subtitle decoding
Bug Fixes
  • Fix layout of individual collection screen
  • Fix photo auto-orientation
  • Fix collections hanging up library scan
  • Fix dashboard showing wrong menu
  • Fix people editing not saving to nfo
  • Several de-interlacing fixes
  • Add Omdb fix for episode images
Legacy Xml Metadata Updates

 

Going forward, if you need support for Media Browser 2 legacy XML, please install the Xml Metadata plugin from the Emby plugin catalog. This includes xml metadata for movies and tv shows, as well as the metadata folder for episodes.

Title: Emby Now Available for 2014 Samsung Smart TV's
Description: Installation Users in the USA with a Samsung Smart TV can install now from the Samsung App Store. A Modern App for Modern Times The interface for this app has been built with HTML, but this is nothing like the web apps you're accustomed to. This has been built purely with modern features that bring a level of performance that wasn't even possible a year ago at this time. For the nerds out there, that means WebAnimations, WebComponents, Service Workers, Polymer, and on and on.  Simple and Beautiful   Rediscover your Content with Recommendations A popular feature from other Emby apps is finally making it's way to Emby Theater.  New Music Interface The app finally has a design that makes sense for music.   Live TV Watch Live TV or manage your recordings.  Details Gone Vertical A common complaint over the detail screen of the current Emby Theater is that it's pretty but slow to navigate. We went back to the drawing board and decided to take a little inspiration from Android TV. It is now much, much faster to browse through detail screens.   Learn How to Create SkinsCan you do HTML and JavaScript? Then why not fork the default skin? http://emby.media/community/index.php?/blog/1/entry-302-learn-how-to-create-skins-for-emby-theater/ Let us know what changes and improvements you're able to come up with. You can even release your forked version to the Emby community! Installation Users in the USA with a Samsung Smart TV can install now from the Samsung App Store.
DescriptionHtml:
Installation

 

Users in the USA with a Samsung Smart TV can install now from the Samsung App Store.

 

A Modern App for Modern Times

 

The interface for this app has been built with HTML, but this is nothing like the web apps you're accustomed to. This has been built purely with modern features that bring a level of performance that wasn't even possible a year ago at this time. For the nerds out there, that means WebAnimations, WebComponents, Service Workers, Polymer, and on and on.

 

 

Simple and Beautiful

 

 

 

Rediscover your Content with Recommendations

 

A popular feature from other Emby apps is finally making it's way to Emby Theater.

 

 

New Music Interface

 

The app finally has a design that makes sense for music.

 

 

 

Live TV

 

Watch Live TV or manage your recordings.

 

 

Details Gone Vertical

 

A common complaint over the detail screen of the current Emby Theater is that it's pretty but slow to navigate. We went back to the drawing board and decided to take a little inspiration from Android TV. It is now much, much faster to browse through detail screens.

 

 

 

Learn How to Create Skins
Can you do HTML and JavaScript? Then why not fork the default skin?

 

http://emby.media/community/index.php?/blog/1/entry-302-learn-how-to-create-skins-for-emby-theater/

 

Let us know what changes and improvements you're able to come up with. You can even release your forked version to the Emby community!

 

Installation

 

Users in the USA with a Samsung Smart TV can install now from the Samsung App Store.

Title: Emby for Android TV New Interface
Description: Version 1.4 of the Android TV app (available soon on Google Play and your Fire TV) now changes the library browsing interface to have "tabs" like the web app and Theater. You now should be able to quickly get to the different views of each library and choose how that library is displayed when you first enter it. This new presentation should now be the same as most of the other apps - helping users that use apps on multiple platforms be instantly familiar with the interface.     For Movie and TV libraries, you can choose both whether this new view or a plain grid view is used and, if the new tab view is used, you can select your default tab when the library is opened each time.  We really hope you enjoy this updated and more consistent interface and that it helps you easily navigate to where you want to be quicker. As always, leave feedback in the appropriate forum. Thanks!
DescriptionHtml:
Version 1.4 of the Android TV app (available soon on Google Play and your Fire TV) now changes the library browsing interface to have "tabs" like the web app and Theater.

 

You now should be able to quickly get to the different views of each library and choose how that library is displayed when you first enter it. This new presentation should now be the same as most of the other apps - helping users that use apps on multiple platforms be instantly familiar with the interface.

 

 

 

 

 

For Movie and TV libraries, you can choose both whether this new view or a plain grid view is used and, if the new tab view is used, you can select your default tab when the library is opened each time.

 

 

We really hope you enjoy this updated and more consistent interface and that it helps you easily navigate to where you want to be quicker. As always, leave feedback in the appropriate forum. Thanks!

Title: Emby for Chromecast Receives Major Update
Description: We've updated our Chromecast app with new features and improvements. Here are the highlights. Consistent Detail Screen The detail screen now matches our other apps more closely, with added media information, taglines, and more. Playback Improvements Our automatic quality feature has improved. Additionally Chromecast will now enjoy more aggressive direct play with the ability to automatically switch to transcoding if there is a problem when direct playing. Subtitle Improvements The app can now handle more text-based subtitle formats without the need for server transcoding. Say goodbye to the pain on your server from subtitle burn in. Music Improvements You'll now enjoy a nice audio fade out when stopping music, like many of our other apps. Additionally music playback still start quicker than ever before. Photo Improvements Just tap a photo from the sending app and it will start a slideshow on Chromecast (Requires soon to be released Android and iOS updates). Remote Control Improvements Remote control is now much more responsive. This requires the latest version of Emby Server, which is currently 3.2.19. How to Get The UpdateTo receive the update, simply power cycle your Chromecast device and restart the casting app. Check out our Chromecast WikiLearn more about the app on our wiki at: https://github.com/MediaBrowser/Wiki/wiki/Chromecast
DescriptionHtml:
We've updated our Chromecast app with new features and improvements. Here are the highlights.

 

Consistent Detail Screen

 

The detail screen now matches our other apps more closely, with added media information, taglines, and more.

 

Playback Improvements

 

Our automatic quality feature has improved. Additionally Chromecast will now enjoy more aggressive direct play with the ability to automatically switch to transcoding if there is a problem when direct playing.

 

Subtitle Improvements

 

The app can now handle more text-based subtitle formats without the need for server transcoding. Say goodbye to the pain on your server from subtitle burn in.

 

Music Improvements

 

You'll now enjoy a nice audio fade out when stopping music, like many of our other apps. Additionally music playback still start quicker than ever before.

 

Photo Improvements

 

Just tap a photo from the sending app and it will start a slideshow on Chromecast (Requires soon to be released Android and iOS updates).

 

Remote Control Improvements

 

Remote control is now much more responsive. This requires the latest version of Emby Server, which is currently 3.2.19.

 

How to Get The Update
To receive the update, simply power cycle your Chromecast device and restart the casting app.

 

Check out our Chromecast Wiki
Learn more about the app on our wiki at: https://github.com/MediaBrowser/Wiki/wiki/Chromecast
